subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and Java 1.5 'enum's
msgSnippet: The problem seems to be in the *runtime* -- not *compile-time* -- classpath... -- Cedric ... -- Cédric [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
The problem seems to be in the *runtime* -- not *compile-time* --
classpath...

--
Cedric


On 10/18/06, jscottwarren <jared.warren@...> wrote:
>
> All -
>
> Sorry if this is already answered, but I can't find it.
>
> I have a test case that excercises a Java 1.5 'enum'. This test case
> works just fine in Eclipse 3.2.0 with the Java 1.5 JDK installed.
> However; when I execute those tests from 'ant' using the 'junit' task,
> they fail with a NoClassDefFoundError on the 'enum' "class."
>
> I've tried upgrading to Ant 1.7.0Beta3, thinking that perhaps my old
> (1.6.5) installation wasn't compiled with Java 1.5. I've also
> upgraded my junit.jar to junit-4.1.jar. I've also ensure that all of
> my "targets" and "source" attributes to the javac task are set to
> "1.5". Nothing seems to help.
>
> Any advice would be HUGELY appreciated.
>
> Thanks!
> jared
